text: Pouring at Sierra Nevada Beer Camp 2016 in Boston. Pours a clear gold with a thin white head. Soft corn and cream on the nose. Medium bodied, grain, sweet and full of corn. Softly sweet with a light bitterness on the finish.

On draft at Row 34, Portsmouth. We may have hit "peak craft", when theres now craft malt liquor, but who cares. Its sweet, surprisingly clean, and tastes like a generic corn lager with a little more hops, but itd go pretty well with a bbq or riding the rails.
Draft. Clear golden color, fluffy white head. Aroma of cereal and light lemon. Taste starts sweet, lightly bready. OK.

Im not sure the world needs really good malt liquor but apparently thats what it has. Clear gold with minimal head. Sweet corn predominates but a nice bitter kick in the finish keeps things balanced.

Sampler at brewpub. Pours golden with a white head. Doesn't leave much lacing. Not a lot on the nose. Kind of sweet on the tongue though very crisp and refreshing as well. Finished clean with no bitter beer face and hides it's booze well. Certainly the best malt liquor I've ever had but given the shittiness of the style that ain't saying much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap-white head with trailing lace-hazy yellow. A-corn, spice, slight fusal?
T-spice hops, corn/grain, slight alcohol.

Draft to taster at Dutchs from Aug. 2015 notes. Pours a clear golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have corn, sweet malts, mild floral notes, some alcohol, smooth, a splash of caramel, actually drinkable, not something I would repeat, but decent for what it is.

Tap at Farmhouse Tap & Grill, VT. It pours lightly hazy golden - amber with a decent white head. The nose is soft, sweet, malty, sweetcorn, toasty grain, alcohol and bread. The taste is big alcohol boost upfront, corn, white bread, rubbing alcohol, cornbread, floral, spice, grass and some green vegetables with a warming, boosty finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Pretty drinkable stuff, which gets ya boosted. Grade A malt liqueur fo sure.

Growler: Corn nose. Hazy amber, thin head with almost no retention. Intense corn and hay. Grass finish. No fusel alcohol. Medium body, easy carbonation. One of the very few malt liquors Ive actually enjoyed.

8/4/15. Oh snap, random ML tick on tap at Kickbacks! Golden pour with a small khaki head, mild lacing. Wow, actually smells and tastes like a (cleaner) malt liquor. Corny, boozy, doughy, some caramel, hints at Apple and grape drink. I kept forgetting what I had in my snifter and then took a big gulp and remembered. Awesome.

Pale golden
Aroma is nice. Bitter, good pine and orange aroma. Clean taste, sweet, actually a bit of ethanol taste

32oz bottle opened at Ratebeer Farmhouse Magnum Tasting v1. Malt Likka! Whos the asshole that brought this shit? Oh, yeah, that was me. Pours light yellow gold with a white head. Aroma is corn, saaz, mild skunk. Flavor is sweet, corn, just a bit of earthy Saaz. 8% well hidden.

Willrunforbeer beer with the share. 32 oz. Bottle was NOT placed in a brown paper bag. Clear gold color with lasting head. Aroma is corn husk, yeast, straw. 
The body is medium side with big corn finish. Dear lord, this is one bad ass malt liquor. Could be the smoothest I ever had. Could be the best ever... Perhaps I need to try more.

Poured from 32oz bottle thanks Willrunforbeer for the Ratebeer Farmhouse Magnum Tasting. Clear golden pour with a one finger white head. Aromas of corn bread and citrus. Taste is moderate sweet and follows aroma.
Bottle: This is the best fucken liquid that has ever passed through my facehole. When I die, I want my casket to be lined with empty bottles of this sweet nectar.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: pours orange with a white head. Aroma is citrus and corn and bread. Taste is citrusy and kind os soapy in a citrus dish soap kind of way. Body is super light in apite of the high alcohol. Weird...

Draught at Foundry on Elm SmuttGash event, 5/28/15Light blonde ale with some brassy tinges and a good amount of white head. Clarity and retention are high.Malty in the nose with perfumey alcohol notes and soft, floral hops sitting lightly in the background. The sugars are fairly well-attenuated and Im not getting all that much corn; certainly wouldnt pick it out blind. I think a lot of people would judge this differently blind.The flavor is on the more dry side, though some sweetness certainly remains, mixing with alcohol to create a very floral, poignant, almost sharp note (biting in to a honeysuckle, lilacs, violets). Incredibly smooth, near silky texture with ample carbonation. Just like Liquor de Malt, proof that corn is not an inferior adjunct when used respectfully (more or less, like any other potential ingredient). Loved the stuff, woulda had another.
Draft at the craft beer festival , beer at the pier in the south street seaport. Light color with a strong scent of corn and yeast, Very good for this style of beer
Tap. Clear yellow pour. Citrus, lemon and oak. Medium body. Refreshing carbonation. Nice during a warm weather
Sampled during Julios 2015 Spring Tasting. Yep, its malt liquor alright. Granted, a step up from Colt 45 but still malt liquor. Pass.

Pale yellow pour with a pretty large frothy head. Aroma is fruity with citrus notes and some booziness. Taste is of moderately sweet. Light fizzy carbonation. Much better than anticipate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is fruity with some citrus. Very light yellow color with a pretty large frothy head. Taste is of tropical fruits, malts, and booze. Light fizz with a medium feel and actually quite refreshing. Overall, this was better than what I was expecting and I thoroughly enjoyed the offering.

Lovely capped quart bottle (bottled on 3/15/15) which I will be saving and reusing. Nose is lightly citric, sweet pale malt but thinned by corn. Very clear, very rich golden pour with abundant carbonation and a large, sudsy beige head. Malty, boozy taste lightly perfumed with hops, sweet with corn/adjunct, light spice. Creamy with a touch of corn, varied citrus, clean.  Only slightly crisp medium body, but the maltiness isnt undercut at all. But really, think gentle booze/warmth and perfume ... too classy for the paper bag!

My tenth malt liquor and big thanks to smutty for making kne i enjoy. Comes in kick ass quart bottle. Golden pour white fluffy head. Nose is corn and malt just what u want from style. Tastes of corn, malt, toffee, light vanilla, and grapefruit skin. Still has the malt liquor bite to it. Buzz is justbright after polishing tnis bottle. Best malt liquor Ive had to date.
on draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. golden pour, creamy bodied. sweet maltiness, light cornn notes. i liked this
One of a large number of samples I had at the Extreme Beer Fest in Boston 3/21/32014. Big lager, surprisingly smooth, interesting beer!
